How much % of close auction quantity we recognize. Eg: 90 means we consider 900 volume for 1000 IEV.

This feature is 1 when Fair Value is enabled, and 0 otherwise.

To adjust the raw FV in bps, both negative (to make the FV more passive) and positive (to the aggressive side) offsets are applicable. Note that the FVOffsetBp setting would override FVSpreadMultiplier

The minimum value for FVOffsetBP (configurable by client)
To adjust the raw FV (i.e. 5-minute rolling VWAP) to the aggressive side by the multiple of the average spread

The percentage of parent quantity that we want to post as IWould passive at any time.

Number of bps from limit price to post passive orders. Larger number means more passive. Affects passive placer
Parent Order Quantity / Average daily volume for past 20 days
Determines when order placement for pm auction begins. Later time means market sees our order later, but also means higher risk for order entering.
% change in target quantity threshold for each depth in passive posting. Orders only change within threshold. Small number means less likely for orders to change, thus preserving queue priority.
Multiple of the range spread factor. Used to calculate other fields such as AheadSecs. Larger number means larger ahead secs
Adjusts other scheduler fields. A larger number means larger AheadSeconds
Start time from which relative limit reference is taken
Cap which we do not exceed due to the Scaler. Note this number can be exceeded if Must Finish is on and there's not enough time to finish otherwise.
Used to scale the MarketView parameter to keep results within a grid of -1 to +1
participation rate we aim to have the schedule start at, before scaling
Strategy
AGGR:0.7, NORM:1, PASS:1.3. more passive means wider ahead and behindSecs (bands). More aggressive means narrower bands (follow schedule more closely)
Factor used to adjust behind target
Adjusts the AheadTargetQty. if this is set larger, then the floor for AheadTargetQty will be higher.
Time when order arrives
Adjusts Ahead and BehindSeconds. If this is set larger, Ahead and BehindSeconds will increase.
Adjusts the Ahead and BehindSeconds. If this is set larger, Ahead and BehindSeconds will increase.
Use IntervalVolume from the morning regardless of order accept time and LimitPx. This parameter won't work for POV/DPOV
